Overview of the etc5523nhu Package

overview.Rmd

Introduction

The etc5523nhu package provides data and an interactive Shiny app for exploring the burden of healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) in Germany and the EU/EEA, based on Zacher et al.¬†(2019).

It was developed as part of ETC5523 ‚Äì Communicating with Data: Assignment 4.

Data

The dataset hai_burden was created from Table 2 in Zacher et al.¬†(2019) using R.
It was first defined manually with tibble::tribble() to include estimated values for each infection type and measure, then reshaped to long format using tidyr::pivot_longer().

I also added simulated uncertainty intervals (ci_low and ci_high) to make the plots more realistic and visually informative.

Finally, the dataset was saved to the package with usethis::use_data(hai_burden, overwrite = TRUE).

library(etc5523nhu)
data("hai_burden")
knitr::kable(head(hai_burden), caption = "Preview of the hai_burden dataset")
Preview of the hai_burden dataset
Measure Sample HAP UTI BSI SSI CDI All
HAIs_per_100k German_PPS 132.0 265.1 33.4 115.4 44.6 592.1
HAIs_per_100k German_convenience 162.3 228.7 52.7 146.9 44.5 636.1
HAIs_per_100k EU_EEA 143.7 174.7 22.2 111.3 16.0 467.9
Deaths_per_100k German_PPS 4.9 4.5 4.8 2.9 2.4 20.1
Deaths_per_100k German_convenience 6.1 3.9 7.9 3.7 2.5 24.4
Deaths_per_100k EU_EEA 5.3 3.0 3.3 2.6 0.9 15.3

The Shiny App

Launch the interactive dashboard with:

run_app()

The app allows users to:

  • Select infection types and compare metrics

  • Explore differences between German and EU/EEA samples

  • Interpret results through dynamic plots and explanatory text

Reference

Zacher B., Haller S., Willrich N., Walter J., Abu Sin M., Cassini A., Plachouras D., Suetens C., & Eckmanns T. (2019). Application of a new methodology and R package reveals a high burden of healthcare-associated infections in Germany compared to the average in the EU/EEA, 2011‚Äì2012. EuroSurveillance, 24(46), 1900135. https://www.eurosurveillance.org/content/10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135
